sentences.en: As the crisis worsened, the authorities imposed a news blackout .
sentences.cn: 危机逐渐加深，当局实行了新闻封锁。

sentences.en: David's headlights were fitted with blackout masks, but he drove very fast just the same.
sentences.cn: 虽然前灯上装着闭灯罩, 大卫仍驱车如飞.

sentences.en: Driving through England in the blackout was a weird experience.
sentences.cn: 在灯火管制时期驱车于英格兰大地,简直是不可思议的事情.

sentences.en: Due to a slip - up at the power plant, there was a five hour blackout.
sentences.cn: 发电厂的疏忽导致停电五小时.

sentences.en: Excessive use of air conditions can cause a blackout.
sentences.cn: 过度使用空调会引起停电.

sentences.en: He has a total blackout for events of the evening.
sentences.cn: 那天晚上发生的事情他全都记不清了.

sentences.en: He keeps a flashlight in the cupboard in case of a blackout.
sentences.cn: 他在橱柜上放了一只手电筒,以防停电.

sentences.en: I was trapped inside an elevator during the blackout.
sentences.cn: 停电时,我被关在电梯里.

sentences.en: MU free tickets can not be traveled within MU Blackout Dates.
sentences.cn: 在以下期间,东航免票不得使用.

sentences.en: Paraguay, which shares the dam with Brazil, also suffered a major blackout.
sentences.cn: 与巴西共用大坝的巴拉圭也遭受了大停电.

sentences.en: She had a blackout and couldn't remember anything about the accident.
sentences.cn: 她眼前一黑，那场事故就怎么也想不起来了。

sentences.en: The action had already plunged huge segments of the state into total electric blackout.
sentences.cn: 这一行动使本州大片地区陷入全面停电.

sentences.en: The blackout forced us to call it a day.
sentences.cn: 停电让我们不得不收工了.

sentences.en: The hospital has an auxiliary power system in case of blackout.
sentences.cn: 这家医院装有备用发电系统以防灯火管制.

sentences.en: The radio blackout ends as the spacecraft slows down.
sentences.cn: 随着航天飞机减慢速度,无线电通信又重新恢复.

sentences.en: The snow and the blackout combined to make motoring perilous.
sentences.cn: 大雪加上灯火管制使得车辆行驶成了危险的事.

sentences.en: There was an electricity black-out in a large area in the north of the country.
sentences.cn: 该国北方有一大片地区都停电了。

words.tran_cn: 灯火管制；灯火熄灭；暂时的意识丧失

trans.tran_cn: 灯火管制期，停电，暂时失去知觉，（新闻等的） 封锁
trans.tran_en: a period during a war when all the lights in a town or city must be turned off
